page.title: 04Education
page.content: There is one school in Sutton Benger, which serves both that village and Draycot Cerne. It is a Church of England Controlled Primary School, with a role of about 80 pupils aged 5 to 11 years. There are three full-time teachers, and two part-time teachers. Good parental support provides extra activities, like music, cookery and woodwork. Older pupils are transported to the large Comprehensive School in Chippenham, where there is also a Technical College. The parent group, the Friends of Sutton Benger School, hold many fund- raising events to provide "extras" for the school. In recent years they have financed the erection of the school hall and lobby area. Their latest purchases include the BBC computer and a radio cassette recorder.
